items.title: Why scientists are using corals from other countries to help save Florida's reefs
bullets: • Scientists are breeding corals from Florida, Honduras and the Cayman Islands to combat climate change
• Over the past two years, 80% of the world's reefs saw dangerous levels of heat, which causes coral to bleach
• Florida coral has been crossbred with coral from Honduras, creating what researchers call "Flonduran" corals

items.title: Everything you need to know about Biden's student loan forgiveness program

• A federal district court judge struck down the program on November 10, 2022, prompting the government to stop taking applications
• A decision is expected by late June or early July

items.title: From problem to possibility: how your attention can improve your life
bullets: • Jodie Jackson, a specialist in the way the brain forms habits, explains how our most valuable resource is our attention
• Your attention decides how your hours are spent, what you notice, how you feel, and ultimately, what gets created in your life
• In a world of constant digital noise, by reclaiming our attention we can improve our lives

• The themes of independence are there, and there are good ideas throughout

items.title: Scientists just found the shocking reason Chile’s quake shook so hard
bullets: • A massive quake struck Calama, Chile, in 2024, surprising scientists with its unusual depth and destructive power
• Unlike typical deep quakes, it broke past thermal limits and triggered an intense “thermal runaway” rupture
• Researchers say the event challenges long-held theories and highlights the need for improved monitoring and preparedness

items.title: Scientists just recreated a wildfire that made its own weather
bullets: • California’s Creek Fire became so intense that it generated its own thunderstorm, a phenomenon called a pyrocumulonimbus cloud

• The fire's extreme heat produced an explosive thunderhead that spewed lightning strikes and fanned the roaring flames, making containment elusive and endangering the lives of firefighters on the ground
• Until now, scientists have struggled to replicate them in Earth system models, hindering our ability to predict their occurrence and understand their impacts on the global climate

items.title: Kraven the Hunter: Action Thrills, Story Spills
bullets: • The story itself is jumbled, struggling with pacing issues that make the first act drag unnecessarily
